divs: sighting details after conducting fire training operations for new firefighters, my crew was refilling our pumper\tanker at a hydrant located at the intersection of bonanza dr and morganton rd. it was dark, save for the light of the streetlamps and from the apparatus (our emergency lights were not on). since this a relatively mundane operation and i was confident with the skills of the recruits, i stood to the side watching them and looking around. suddenly, from the north, a green light appeared and traveled from horizon to horizon (north to south) in less than 2 seconds. the object traveled in a straight line, silently, with little or no tail trailing it. at first i was stunned, not sure if i had really seen it. then i thought it was a "shooting star" but it did not appear as any shooting star i had seen in the past. i asked the others if they saw it and they all answered "no". i continued to watch the sky and failed to see any other unusual activity. some time later, i saw the exact same thing again but the location and date of that sighting escapes me.
Summary: Green Light Traveling at high speed
